did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This is a collection of 22 handwritten Lebanon, CT related day books, account books and ledgers ranging in date from circa 1750 to 1949. Most include agricultural records often in combination with personal, trade, business, community and legal activities and expenses. Trades represented include coopering, carpentry, blacksmithing, farrier work, cigar making, and store keeping.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was assembled by the Lebanon Historical Society from a variety of local sources between 1977 and 2017. There were nine identified donors and one anonymous donor, three with no recorded source and one transferred from the Scotland, CT Historical Society with no acquisition information recorded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of 22 account books, day books and other financial ledgers kept by Lebanon, CT men or containing references to business done in Lebanon, CT between circa 1750 and 1949. Most include references to farming as a primary business activity with secondary income sources from work as craftsmen, storekeepers, lawyers and town officials.

note.p: Includes 4 items: 1981.103.001 – Ambrose Williams; farming, coopering, livestock & vehicle rentals, wife's sewing & knitting – subsequently Julius Clark farming account (1792-1871); 1981.103.002 – Julius Clark; farming; (1816-1857); 1998.019.002 – David S. Woodworth: store keeping, treasurer’s accounts for local organizations (1853-1881); 1998.019.003 – David S. Woodworth; continuation of above and probate processing for Samuel Bailey estate (ca.1865-1891)

Includes 2 items: 1999.000.236 – Peleg Thomas; farming, supplies for Revolutionary War soldiers families, housing for widows and their children, general farming (many pages covered with late 19th century newspaper clippings (ca. 1750-1790); 2006.024.001 – William Fuller; farming, carpentry, cigar making (1844-ca.1870)
Includes 2 items: 2006.018.002 – Manning & Lathrop; mercantile business; 2006.018.003 – anonymous; farming, tannery, shoe-making, general leather work & repair
Includes 2 items: 2002.021.001 – Prince Brewster; tavern keeping (1763-1800); 2004.006.001 – anonymous; farming, horse shoeing, general mercantile trading (1833-1876)

Includes 5 items: 2001.022.004 – anonymous; wagon repairs, hay selling, "rope account" (1867-1871); 2002.019.001 – anonymous; store keeper’s accounts(1829); 2003.083.002 – T.H. Ward; general store keeping, farm produce (1883-1884); 2006.018.004 – John Kneeland; store keeping (1885-1887); 2015.011.007 – anonymous; faming, Congregational Church (1830-1876)
